author: Mychael Schnell
description: The Problem Solvers Caucus, a bipartisan coalition of House lawmakers that frequently works across the aisle, is requesting a meeting with President Trump to discuss immigration, permitting reform and the national debt. Reps. Brian Fitzpatrick (R-Pa.) and Tom Suozzi (D-N.Y.), the co-chairs of the caucus, sent a letter to Trump on Monday, focusing on the trio issues…
title: Bipartisan Problem Solvers Caucus requests meeting with Trump on immigration, debt

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Cincinnati Police Department Chief Teresa Theetge slammed the behavior of individuals captured on tape participating in a violent brawl as “nothing short of cruel,” saying her team is working to identify individuals involved. “I am in complete disgust waking up to the viral video many of you have now seen. The behavior displayed is nothing…
title: Cincinnati police chief blasts behavior of people brawling in viral video

author: Tobias Burns
description: President Trump is staring down a big week on the economy. White House trade talks are intensifying ahead of an Aug. 1 deadline for “reciprocal” tariffs and a Wednesday decision on interest rates from the Federal Reserve. There will also be second-quarter growth results, the monthly jobs report for July, and price data that could…
title: Trump faces critical week on economy

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: A second whistleblower has stepped forward with allegations that Justice Department (DOJ) official Emil Bove worked to defy court orders. Bove, the No. 3 official at President Trump’s DOJ, has been nominated for a lifetime appointment to the 3rd Circuit Court of Appeals and is awaiting a final vote in the Senate. He’s also been accused by DOJ…
title: Second whistleblower backs allegations Bove was ‘undermining rule of law’

author: Miriam Waldvogel
description: A group of congressional Democrats blasted the Trump administration’s decision to allow advanced computer chips made by Nvidia to be sold in China, in a set of letters sent to Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick. In a letter to Lutnick on Sunday, Reps. Raja Krishnamoorthi (D-Ill.) and Gregory Meeks (D-N.Y.) said the administration was using export controls…
title: Democrats blast Lutnick for reversal on China, semiconductors

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: At least two people were killed and three were hospitalized in a shooting early Monday outside a casino in Reno, Nev. A gunman opened fire outside the Grand Sierra Resort casino and shot multiple people before he was taken into custody, police said, noting an officer responded with gunfire after identifying the suspect. “Officers immediately…
title: 2 killed, 3 injured in Reno casino shooting

author: Tara Suter
description: Paul Dans, a principal author of the Heritage Foundation-led Project 2025, is challenging Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.) for his seat in the U.S. Senate, according to The Associated Press. Dans told the news service that “more work” is required beyond the slashing of federal programs and workers outlined in Project 2025. “What we’ve done with…
title: Project 2025 author challenging Graham in SC: Report

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: President Trump’s lawyers want to depose Rupert Murdoch, and quickly. The president’s attorneys in a new court filing Monday said they wish to speak with the conservative media mogul as part of evidence-gathering efforts in connection with Trump’s lawsuit against The Wall Street Journal. “Murdoch is 94 years old, has suffered from multiple health issues…
title: Trump seeks expedited deposition from Rupert Murdoch in WSJ suit

author: Julia Mueller
description: Former Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker (R) is passing on a 2026 gubernatorial campaign after speculation that he could make a run for his old job. “I’m not going to be a candidate for governor in 2026,” Walker said in a video posted to X on Sunday, thanking supporters who encouraged him to run again.  After…
title: Former Wisconsin governor Scott Walker passes on another campaign

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Conservative pundit Megyn Kelly has hired Hope Hicks, a political operative and close ally of President Trump, to help run her growing media company, which Kelly launched after a career in cable and network news. Hicks, who worked as an executive at Fox Corp. before joining Trump during his first term as communication director, will…
title: Megyn Kelly hires Hope Hicks as she expands media company

author: Joseph Choi
description: A top U.S. health lobbying group is calling on Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to not dismiss a preventive care task force following a report he’s planning to remove all of its members in the same way he ousted an entire vaccine advisory board earlier this year. The American Medical Association…
title: Top medical group presses RFK Jr. to keep health screening panel

author: Sharon Udasin
description: The planet has endured massive freshwater losses over the past two decades due to the combined effects of climate change, overconsumption and drought, a new study has found. Arid land areas are expanding at a rate roughly twice the size of California each year, according to the study, published in Science Advances. Dry spots are now…
title: Freshwater is disappearing from the Earth at alarming rates: Study

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Glenn Kessler, The Washington Post’s longtime lead fact-checker, announced Monday he had taken a buyout, becoming the latest in a slew of the outlet’s top journalists to leave in recent months. “Much as I would have liked to keep scrutinizing politicians in Washington, especially in this era, the financial considerations were impossible to dismiss,” Kessler…
title: Washington Post fact-checker takes buyout

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: French Prime Minister François Bayrou is criticizing the trade deal struck by President Trump and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen as an act of “submission” by the European Union (EU). “It is a dark day when an alliance of free peoples, united to affirm their values and defend their interests, resolves to submission,”…
title: France denounces US-EU trade deal: ‘Submission’

author: Sylvan Lane
description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said a new Samsung plant in Texas will be devoted to making the next generation of semiconductors for the electric vehicle (EV) company as it pushes the needle on artificial intelligence (AI). In a Sunday post on X, the social media platform he purchased in 2022, Musk said Samsung’s new factory…
title: Elon Musk says new Samsung plant will make Tesla AI chips

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: A federal judge in Boston on Monday blocked the Trump administration from cutting funding to all Planned Parenthood affiliates as part of the GOP’s new tax cut and health law.  The ruling by U.S. District Judge Indira Talwani expands on a decision last week, when she issued a preliminary injunction restoring Medicaid funding for only…
title: Judge orders Medicaid funding temporarily restored to all Planned Parenthood affiliates

description: Vice President Vance traveled to his home state of Ohio on Monday to promote the GOP’s sweeping tax-and-border bill. At an event in the city of Canton, Vance was expected to talk about the bill’s “benefits for hardworking American families and businesses,” according to his office. Watch video coverage in the player above.
title: Watch: Vance touts ‘big, beautiful bill’ in Ohio

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Sen. Ruben Gallego (D-Ariz.) is traveling to New Hampshire next month, ramping up speculation about potential presidential ambitions ahead of 2028. Gallego is heading to the Granite State to participate in a “Politics & Eggs” event, hosted by the New England Council and the New Hampshire Institute of Politics at Saint Anselm College, on Aug.…
title: Gallego headed to New Hampshire amid 2028 speculation

author: Amber Coakley
description: Hidden high in the White Mountains of eastern California, a gnarled, weathered tree quietly holds a staggering secret — it's nearly 5,000 years old.
title: The tree in California that’s older than the Egyptian pyramids

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Rep. Ralph Norman (R-S.C.) on Sunday announced he’s launching a bid to succeed term-limited South Carolina Gov. Henry McMaster (R), making him the latest Republican to throw his hat in the mix. “I’ve seen way too many corrupt politicians in Columbia, South Carolina, looking out for themselves and not for you. And in Washington, I’ve…
title: Rep. Ralph Norman launches bid for South Carolina governor

author: Svante Myrick, opinion contributor
description: The policies of the Trump administration require the systemic suppression of empathy.
title: As Hollywood taps into American empathy, conservatives call it a sin

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Comedian Jay Leno bemoaned increased partisanship and political humor on late-night shows, saying comics who opt for political jokes are making a mistake. “I love political humor, don’t get me wrong,” the former host of “The Tonight Show” said during a recent interview. “But it’s just what happens when people wind up cozying too much…
title: Jay Leno rips partisanship in late-night shows

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Sen. Mark Kelly (D-Ariz.) declined to say whether he plans to run for president in 2028, stressing instead that he’s focused on addressing voters’ concerns about the Democratic Party. In an interview on CNN’s “State of the Union,” anchor Jake Tapper noted the swing-state senator was video-conferencing in from Pennsylvania and recently did a town…
title: Mark Kelly on possible White House bid: ‘I’m not going to give you a yes or no answer’

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump said Monday the United States would be getting more involved in getting food into Gaza amid an ongoing humanitarian crisis. Trump told reporters during a meeting with British Prime Minister Keir Starmer that the U.S. would work to set up “food centers” in Gaza. He did not provide specifics on whether the U.S.…
title: Trump says US will assist with ‘food centers’ in Gaza

author: John Kenneth White, opinion contributor
description: 2028 is Moore’s time.
title: Wes Moore should take his talents to the White House

author: Barry Owens
description: “I’m not even on cloud nine, I’m on like cloud 12,” the sheriff's deputy said after meeting the English rock singer.
title: ‘Cool guy’: 80s rockstar pulled over in Kansas en route to show

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Vice President Vance would be a “great nominee” for the Republican Party in 2028, should he decide to run for the White House. In an interview on Fox News’s “My View with Lara Trump,” Rubio sidestepped a question about his own presidential ambitions when asked by the president’s daughter-in-law…
title: Rubio: Vance would be ‘great’ GOP nominee in 2028 ‘if he decides he wants to do that’

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) weighed in on talk of a possible pardon for Ghislaine Maxwell, saying the 20-year sentence she received for conspiring with the late disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors was not harsh enough. Johnson said during an interview on NBC News’s “Meet the Press” that it’s up to President Trump…
title: Johnson on talk of Maxwell pardon: ’20 years was a pittance’

author: Gregory Lyakhov, opinion contributor
description: If the Trump administration truly aims to uphold ideological neutrality and preserve intellectual freedom, cutting off funding to biased government institutions is just the first step. The greater challenge lies in confronting powerful private entities like Google, which function as modern-day gatekeepers of public discourse.
title: Watch out, Google: Trump should move online in his fight against left-wing bias

description: President Trump has been meeting with British Prime Minister Keir Starmer for “wide-ranging talks” on Monday. Trump and Starmer were expected to discuss the implementation of the U.S.-U.K. trade deal, agreed to in May, the prime minister’s office said Sunday. The struggle to reach a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, along with the hunger crisis…
title: Watch: Trump meets UK prime minister

author: Ashley N. Soriano
description: Members of an advisory panel have proposed adding warning labels to some medication about adverse maternal and fetal risks in pregnancy.
title: FDA considers warning about antidepressants during pregnancy

author: Addy Bink
description: Grand Traverse County Sheriff Michael Shea said the “remarkable” efforts of the bystanders likely prevented others from being harmed.
title: Video: Group appears to confront, stop suspect in Michigan Walmart stabbing

author: Sahara Sriraman
description: The Virginia Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services (VDACS) has confirmed the detection of a new invasive insect in the Commonwealth: the box tree moth.
title: Invasive moth spreads to new state: Where else has it been detected?

author: Susan Atkinson, opinion contribution
description: Congress voted to pass a massive budget package that, among other things, drastically cuts clean energy tax credits to reduce federal spending. Claiming victory, President Trump signed the One Big Beautiful Bill Act into law on July 4. Indeed, taxpayer dollars subsidizing any special industry can play havoc with the intelligence and efficiency of the…
title: Congress should eliminate all energy subsidies, not just for renewables

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: The Ohio State University (OSU) President Ted Carter said on Sunday that he thinks Ivy League schools are in “survival mode,” when asked about Columbia University’s settlement with the Trump administration. In an interview on CBS News’s “Face the Nation,” moderator Margaret Brennan asked Carter whether he’s troubled by the “precedent” that the settlement sets…
title: Ohio State University president: Ivy League presidents ‘in survival mode, quite frankly’
